intro: Herniaria lusitanica var. gaditana, commonly known as the Iberian sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Europe. It typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal areas and dry habitats. The plant features small, green, fleshy leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, and it produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers. It is well adapted to harsh environments, showing resistance to drought and salt spray. This variety is part of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth and unique morphological traits.
